an10.62:1.1.pli: “Purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati bhavataṇhāya: ‘ito pubbe bhavataṇhā nāhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī’ti.
an10.62:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, it is said that no prior point of craving for continued existence is evident, before which there was no craving for continued existence, and afterwards it came to be.

an10.62:1.2.pli: Evañcetaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati: ‘idappaccayā bhavataṇhā’ti.
an10.62:1.2.eng: And yet it is evident that there is a specific condition for craving for continued existence.

an10.62:2.1.pli: Bhavataṇhampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.1.eng: I say that craving for continued existence is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.2.eng: And what is the fuel for craving for continued existence?

an10.62:2.4.pli: Avijjampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.4.eng: I say that ignorance is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.5.eng: And what is the fuel for ignorance?

an10.62:2.7.pli: Pañca nīvaraṇepāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
an10.62:2.7.eng: I say that the five hindrances are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:2.8.eng: And what is the fuel for the five hindrances?

an10.62:2.9.eng: You should say: ‘The three kinds of misconduct.’

an10.62:2.10.pli: Tīṇipāhaṃ, bhikkhave, duccaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
an10.62:2.10.eng: I say that the three kinds of misconduct are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:2.11.eng: And what is the fuel for the three kinds of misconduct?

an10.62:2.12.eng: You should say: ‘Lack of sense restraint.’

an10.62:2.13.pli: Indriyaasaṃvarampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.13.eng: I say that lack of sense restraint is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.14.eng: And what is the fuel for lack of sense restraint?

an10.62:2.15.eng: You should say: ‘Lack of mindfulness and situational awareness.’

an10.62:2.16.pli: Asatāsampajaññampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.16.eng: I say that lack of mindfulness and situational awareness is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.17.eng: And what is the fuel for lack of mindfulness and situational awareness?

an10.62:2.18.eng: You should say: ‘Irrational application of mind.’

an10.62:2.19.pli: Ayonisomanasikārampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.19.eng: I say that irrational application of mind is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.20.eng: And what is the fuel for irrational application of mind?

an10.62:2.22.pli: Assaddhiyampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.22.eng: I say that lack of faith is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.23.eng: And what is the fuel for lack of faith?

an10.62:2.24.eng: You should say: ‘Listening to an untrue teaching.’

an10.62:2.25.pli: Assaddhammassavanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:2.25.eng: I say that listening to an untrue teaching is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:2.26.eng: And what is the fuel for listening to an untrue teaching?

an10.62:2.27.eng: You should say: ‘Associating with untrue persons.’

an10.62:3.1.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṃsevo paripūro assaddhammassavanaṃ paripūreti, assaddhammassavanaṃ paripūraṃ assaddhiyaṃ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṃ paripūraṃ ayonisomanasikāraṃ paripūreti, ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṃ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṃ paripūraṃ indriyaasaṃvaraṃ paripūreti, indriyaasaṃvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni paripūreti, tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrā avijjaṃ paripūrenti, avijjā paripūrā bhavataṇhaṃ paripūreti;
an10.62:3.1.eng: In this way, when the factor of associating with untrue persons is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to an untrue teaching. When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith … irrational application of mind … lack of mindfulness and situational awareness … lack of sense restraint …the three kinds of misconduct … the five hindrances … ignorance. When ignorance is fulfilled, it fulfills craving for continued existence.

an10.62:3.2.pli: evametissā bhavataṇhāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
an10.62:3.2.eng: That’s the fuel for craving for continued existence, and that’s how it’s fulfilled.

an10.62:4.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṃ udakaṃ yathāninnaṃ pavattamānaṃ pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūreti, pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūrā kusobbhe paripūrenti, kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā paripūrā kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo paripūrā mahāsamuddaṃ sāgaraṃ paripūrenti;
an10.62:4.1.eng: It’s like when the heavens rain heavily on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks. As they become full, they fill up the pools. The pools fill up the lakes, the lakes fill up the streams, and the streams fill up the rivers. And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.

an10.62:4.2.pli: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
an10.62:4.2.eng: That’s the fuel for the ocean, and that’s how it’s filled up.

an10.62:5.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṃsevo paripūro assaddhammassavanaṃ paripūreti, assaddhammassavanaṃ paripūraṃ assaddhiyaṃ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṃ paripūraṃ ayonisomanasikāraṃ paripūreti, ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṃ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṃ paripūraṃ indriyaasaṃvaraṃ paripūreti, indriyaasaṃvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni paripūreti, tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrā avijjaṃ paripūrenti, avijjā paripūrā bhavataṇhaṃ paripūreti;
an10.62:5.1.eng: In the same way, when the factor of associating with untrue persons is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to an untrue teaching. When the factor of listening to an untrue teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of lack of faith … irrational application of mind … lack of mindfulness and situational awareness … lack of sense restraint …the three kinds of misconduct … the five hindrances … ignorance. When ignorance is fulfilled, it fulfills craving for continued existence.

an10.62:5.2.pli: evametissā bhavataṇhāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
an10.62:5.2.eng: That’s the fuel for craving for continued existence, and that’s how it’s fulfilled.

an10.62:6.1.pli: Vijjāvimuttimpāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.1.eng: I say that knowledge and freedom are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:6.2.eng: And what is the fuel for knowledge and freedom?

an10.62:6.3.eng: You should say: ‘The seven awakening factors.’

an10.62:6.4.pli: Sattapāhaṃ, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅge sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
an10.62:6.4.eng: I say that the seven awakening factors are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:6.5.eng: And what is the fuel for the seven awakening factors?

an10.62:6.6.eng: You should say: ‘The four kinds of mindfulness meditation.’

an10.62:6.7.pli: Cattāropāhaṃ, bhikkhave, satipaṭṭhāne sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
an10.62:6.7.eng: I say that the four kinds of mindfulness meditation are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:6.8.eng: And what is the fuel for the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?

an10.62:6.9.eng: You should say: ‘The three kinds of good conduct.’

an10.62:6.10.pli: Tīṇipāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sucaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
an10.62:6.10.eng: I say that the three kinds of good conduct are fueled by something, they’re not unfueled.

an10.62:6.11.eng: And what is the fuel for the three kinds of good conduct?

an10.62:6.13.pli: Indriyasaṃvarampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.13.eng: I say that sense restraint is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:6.14.eng: And what is the fuel for sense restraint?

an10.62:6.15.eng: You should say: ‘Mindfulness and situational awareness.’

an10.62:6.16.pli: Satisampajaññampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.16.eng: I say that mindfulness and situational awareness is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:6.17.eng: And what is the fuel for mindfulness and situational awareness?

an10.62:6.18.eng: You should say: ‘Rational application of mind.’

an10.62:6.19.pli: Yonisomanasikārampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.19.eng: I say that rational application of mind is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:6.20.eng: And what is the fuel for rational application of mind?

an10.62:6.22.pli: Saddhampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.22.eng: I say that faith is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:6.23.eng: And what is the fuel for faith?

an10.62:6.24.eng: You should say: ‘Listening to the true teaching.’

an10.62:6.25.pli: Saddhammassavanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṃ vadāmi, no anāhāraṃ.
an10.62:6.25.eng: I say that listening to the true teaching is fueled by something, it’s not unfueled.

an10.62:6.26.eng: And what is the fuel for listening to the true teaching?

an10.62:6.27.eng: You should say: ‘Associating with true persons.’

an10.62:7.1.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṃsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṃ paripūreti, saddhammassavanaṃ paripūraṃ saddhaṃ paripūreti, saddhā paripūrā yonisomanasikāraṃ paripūreti, yonisomanasikāro paripūro satisampajaññaṃ paripūreti, satisampajaññaṃ paripūraṃ indriyasaṃvaraṃ paripūreti, indriyasaṃvaro paripūro tīṇi sucaritāni paripūreti, tīṇi sucaritāni paripūrāni cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūrenti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti;
an10.62:7.1.eng: In this way, when the factor of associating with true persons is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to the true teaching. When the factor of listening to the true teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of faith … rational application of mind … mindfulness and situational awareness … sense restraint …the three kinds of good conduct … the four kinds of mindfulness meditation … the seven awakening factors. When the seven awakening factors are fulfilled, they fulfill knowledge and freedom.

an10.62:7.2.pli: evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
an10.62:7.2.eng: That’s the fuel for knowledge and freedom, and that’s how it’s fulfilled.

an10.62:8.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṃ udakaṃ yathāninnaṃ pavattamānaṃ …pe…
an10.62:8.1.eng: It’s like when the heavens rain heavily on a mountain top, and the water flows downhill to fill the hollows, crevices, and creeks. As they become full, they fill up the pools. The pools fill up the lakes, the lakes fill up the streams, and the streams fill up the rivers. And as the rivers become full, they fill up the ocean.

an10.62:8.2.pli: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
an10.62:8.2.eng: That’s the fuel for the ocean, and that’s how it’s filled up.

an10.62:8.3.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṃsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṃ paripūreti …pe…
an10.62:8.3.eng: In this way, when the factor of associating with true persons is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of listening to the true teaching. When the factor of listening to the true teaching is fulfilled, it fulfills the factor of faith … rational application of mind … mindfulness and situational awareness … sense restraint …the three kinds of good conduct … the four kinds of mindfulness meditation … the seven awakening factors. When the seven awakening factors are fulfilled, they fulfill knowledge and freedom.

an10.62:8.4.pli: evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūrī”ti.
an10.62:8.4.eng: That’s the fuel for knowledge and freedom, and that’s how it’s fulfilled.”

an10.63:1.1.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi niṭṭhaṃ gatā sabbe te diṭṭhisampannā.
an10.63:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.

an10.63:1.2.pli: Tesaṃ diṭṭhisampannānaṃ pañcannaṃ idha niṭṭhā, pañcannaṃ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
an10.63:1.2.eng: Of those who are accomplished in view, five conclude their path in this realm, and five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.

an10.63:1.3.eng: Which five conclude their path in this realm?

an10.63:1.4.pli: Sattakkhattuparamassa, kolaṅkolassa, ekabījissa, sakadāgāmissa, yo ca diṭṭheva dhamme arahā—
an10.63:1.4.eng: The one who has seven rebirths at most, the one who goes from family to family, the one-seeder, the once returner, and the one who is perfected in this very life.

an10.63:1.5.eng: These five conclude their path in this realm.

an10.63:1.6.eng: Which five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind?

an10.63:1.7.pli: Antarāparinibbāyissa, upahaccaparinibbāyissa, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, uddhaṃsotassa akaniṭṭhagāmino—
an10.63:1.7.eng: The one who is extinguished between one life and the next, the one who is extinguished upon landing, the one who is extinguished without extra effort, the one who is extinguished with extra effort, and the one who heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

an10.63:1.8.eng: These five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.

an10.63:1.9.pli: Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi niṭṭhaṃ gatā, sabbe te diṭṭhisampannā.
an10.63:1.9.eng: All those who have come to a conclusion about me are accomplished in view.

an10.63:1.10.pli: Tesaṃ diṭṭhisampannānaṃ imesaṃ pañcannaṃ idha niṭṭhā, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ idha vihāya niṭṭhā”ti.
an10.63:1.10.eng: Of those who are accomplished in view, these five conclude their path in this realm, and these five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.”

an10.64:1.1.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi aveccappasannā, sabbe te sotāpannā.
an10.64:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, all those who have experiential confidence in me have entered the stream.

an10.64:1.2.pli: Tesaṃ sotāpannānaṃ pañcannaṃ idha niṭṭhā, pañcannaṃ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
an10.64:1.2.eng: Of those who have entered the stream, five conclude their path in this realm, and five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.

an10.64:1.3.eng: Which five conclude their path in this realm?

an10.64:1.4.pli: Sattakkhattuparamassa, kolaṅkolassa, ekabījissa, sakadāgāmissa, yo ca diṭṭheva dhamme arahā—
an10.64:1.4.eng: The one who has seven rebirths at most, the one who goes from family to family, the one-seeder, the once returner, and the one who is perfected in this very life.

an10.64:1.5.eng: These five conclude their path in this realm.

an10.64:1.6.eng: Which five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind?

an10.64:1.7.pli: Antarāparinibbāyissa, upahaccaparinibbāyissa, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, uddhaṃsotassa akaniṭṭhagāmino—
an10.64:1.7.eng: The one who is extinguished between one life and the next, the one who is extinguished upon landing, the one who is extinguished without extra effort, the one who is extinguished with extra effort, and the one who heads upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

an10.64:1.8.eng: These five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.

an10.64:1.9.pli: Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi aveccappasannā sabbe te sotāpannā.
an10.64:1.9.eng: All those who have experiential confidence in me have entered the stream.

an10.64:1.10.pli: Tesaṃ sotāpannānaṃ imesaṃ pañcannaṃ idha niṭṭhā, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ idha vihāya niṭṭhā”ti.
an10.64:1.10.eng: Of those who have entered the stream, these five conclude their path in this realm, and these five conclude their path after leaving this realm behind.”

an10.65:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.
an10.65:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.

an10.65:1.2.pli: Atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
an10.65:1.2.eng: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went up to Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

an10.65:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
an10.65:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāmaṇḍakāni sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:

an10.65:2.1.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, sukhaṃ, kiṃ dukkhan”ti?
an10.65:2.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, what is happiness and what is suffering?”

an10.65:2.2.eng: “Rebirth is suffering, reverend, no rebirth is happiness.

an10.65:2.3.pli: Abhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
an10.65:2.3.eng: When there is rebirth, you can expect this kind of suffering.

an10.65:2.4.pli: sītaṃ uṇhaṃ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo aggisamphasso daṇḍasamphasso satthasamphasso ñātīpi mittāpi saṅgamma samāgamma rosenti.
an10.65:2.4.eng: Cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination. Contact with fire, clubs, and knives. And relatives and friends get together and annoy you.

an10.65:2.5.pli: Abhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ.
an10.65:2.5.eng: When there is rebirth, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.

an10.65:2.6.pli: Anabhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ sukhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
an10.65:2.6.eng: When there is no rebirth, you can expect this kind of happiness.

an10.65:2.7.pli: na sītaṃ na uṇhaṃ na jighacchā na pipāsā na uccāro na passāvo na aggisamphasso na daṇḍasamphasso na satthasamphasso ñātīpi mittāpi saṅgamma samāgamma na rosenti.
an10.65:2.7.eng: No cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, or urination. No contact with fire, clubs, or knives. And relatives and friends don’t get together and annoy you.

an10.65:2.8.pli: Anabhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ sukhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhan”ti.
an10.65:2.8.eng: When there is no rebirth, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”

an10.66:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.
an10.66:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.

an10.66:1.2.pli: Atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
an10.66:1.2.eng: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went up to Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

an10.66:1.3.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
an10.66:1.3.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāmaṇḍakāni sat down to one side and said to Sāriputta:

an10.66:2.1.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, sāriputta, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye sukhaṃ, kiṃ dukkhan”ti?
an10.66:2.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, in this teaching and training, what is happiness and what is suffering?”

an10.66:2.2.pli: “Anabhirati kho, āvuso, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye dukkhā, abhirati sukhā.
an10.66:2.2.eng: “Reverend, in this teaching and training dissatisfaction is suffering and satisfaction is happiness.

an10.66:2.3.pli: Anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
an10.66:2.3.eng: When you’re dissatisfied, you can expect this kind of suffering.

an10.66:2.4.eng: You find no happiness or pleasure while walking …

an10.66:2.10.eng: at the root of a tree …

an10.66:2.14.pli: Anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ dukkhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ.
an10.66:2.14.eng: When you’re dissatisfied, this is the kind of suffering you can expect.

an10.66:3.1.pli: Abhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ sukhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
an10.66:3.1.eng: When you’re satisfied, you can expect this kind of happiness.

an10.66:3.2.eng: You find happiness or pleasure while walking …

an10.66:3.8.eng: at the root of a tree …

an10.66:3.12.pli: Abhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṃ sukhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhan”ti.
an10.66:3.12.eng: When you’re satisfied, this is the kind of happiness you can expect.”

an10.67:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena naḷakapānaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ nigamo tadavasari.
an10.67:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Naḷakapāna.

an10.67:1.2.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā naḷakapāne viharati palāsavane.
an10.67:1.2.eng: There the Buddha stayed near Naḷakapāna in the grove of flame-of-the-forest trees.

an10.67:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto nisinno hoti.
an10.67:1.3.eng: Now, at that time it was the sabbath, and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by a Saṅgha of monks.

an10.67:1.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā tuṇhībhūtaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anuviloketvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
an10.67:1.4.eng: The Buddha spent much of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk. Then he looked around the Saṅgha of mendicants, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta:

an10.67:2.1.eng: “Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.

an10.67:2.2.pli: Paṭibhātu taṃ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammī kathā.
an10.67:2.2.eng: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.

an10.67:2.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato paccassosi.

an10.67:3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā.
an10.67:3.1.eng: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.

an10.67:3.2.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:

an10.67:3.4.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.

an10.67:4.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …
an10.67:4.1.eng: “Reverends, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:4.4.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.67:4.4.eng: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:4.5.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, kāḷapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāyateva vaṇṇena hāyati maṇḍalena hāyati ābhāya hāyati ārohapariṇāhena;
an10.67:4.5.eng: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, luminosity, and diameter and circumference only decline.

an10.67:4.6.pli: evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …
an10.67:4.6.eng: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:4.9.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.67:4.9.eng: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:5.1.eng: A faithless individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.2.eng: An individual with no conscience is in decline.

an10.67:5.3.eng: An imprudent individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.4.eng: A lazy individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.5.eng: A witless individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.6.eng: An irritable individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.7.eng: An acrimonious individual is in decline.

an10.67:5.8.eng: An individual with corrupt wishes is in decline.

an10.67:5.9.eng: An individual with bad friends is in decline.

an10.67:5.10.eng: An individual with wrong view is in decline.

an10.67:6.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
an10.67:6.1.eng: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:6.3.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.67:6.3.eng: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:6.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, juṇhapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vaḍḍhateva vaṇṇena vaḍḍhati maṇḍalena vaḍḍhati ābhāya vaḍḍhati ārohapariṇāhena;
an10.67:6.4.eng: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, luminosity, and diameter and circumference only grow.

an10.67:6.5.pli: evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, yassa kassaci saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
an10.67:6.5.eng: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:6.8.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.67:6.8.eng: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:7.2.eng: An individual with a conscience doesn’t decline.

an10.67:7.8.eng: An individual with few desires doesn’t decline.

an10.67:7.9.eng: An individual with good friends doesn’t decline.

an10.67:7.10.eng: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”

an10.67:8.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
an10.67:8.1.eng: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Sāriputta:

an10.67:8.3.pli: Yassa kassaci, sāriputta, saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …
an10.67:8.3.eng: Whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:8.6.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
an10.67:8.6.eng: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:8.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, kāḷapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāyateva vaṇṇena hāyati maṇḍalena hāyati ābhāya hāyati ārohapariṇāhena;
an10.67:8.7.eng: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, luminosity, and diameter and circumference only decline.

an10.67:8.8.pli: evamevaṃ kho, sāriputta, yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu …pe…
an10.67:8.8.eng: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:8.9.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā …pe… no vuddhi.
an10.67:8.9.eng: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:9.1.eng: A faithless individual is in decline.

an10.67:9.10.eng: An individual with wrong view is in decline.

an10.67:10.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, sāriputta, saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
an10.67:10.1.eng: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:10.4.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.67:10.4.eng: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:10.5.pli: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, juṇhapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vaḍḍhateva vaṇṇena vaḍḍhati maṇḍalena vaḍḍhati ābhāya vaḍḍhati ārohapariṇāhena;
an10.67:10.5.eng: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, luminosity, and diameter and circumference only grow.

an10.67:10.6.pli: evamevaṃ kho, sāriputta, yassa kassaci saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
an10.67:10.6.eng: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

an10.67:10.9.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
an10.67:10.9.eng: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an10.67:11.10.eng: An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”
